value.title: Google’s AI Assistant, Bard, Might be Getting a Makeover as “Gemini”
value.excerpt: Google may be considering to rename its AI Assistant Bard with the name Gemini as flags on the Bard's website suggests. Learn more here.

value.title: AI chatbot Google Bard with Gemini Pro now available in SA
value.excerpt: Google Bard with Gemini has now equalled ChatGPT’s performance on a popular chatbot arena, coming second on the leaderboard

value.title: A new way to discover places with generative AI in Maps
value.excerpt: We’re incorporating generative AI in Maps, to help you discover things to do. Select U.S. Local Guides begin testing the feature this week.

value.title: Google Bard's latest update turns your words into AI images
value.excerpt: The latest update to Bard also brings Google’s Gemini Pro AI model, previously available only in English, to over 40 languages and more than 230 countries and territories, marking a significant milestone in Bard’s accessibility worldwide. Google says Gemini Pro enhances Bard’s understanding, reasoning, summarizing, and coding abilities.

value.title: Google launches an AI-powered image generator
value.excerpt: Google has launched a new image generation tool, ImageFX, powered by its recently released Imagen 2 GenAI model.

value.title: New and better ways to create images with Imagen 2
value.excerpt: We’re rolling out Imagen 2, a major update to our image generation technology. Try it out today in Bard, Image FX, Search and Vertex AI.

value.title: Try ImageFX and MusicFX, our newest generative AI tools in Labs
value.excerpt: ImageFX, MusicFX and TextFX help you bring your most creative ideas to life with Google’s latest AI capabilities.

value.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai confirms Bard Advanced will be Google’s answer to Microsoft’s Copilot Pro
value.excerpt: Microsoft announced Copilot Pro, a subscription-based tier of its AI-powered tool for power users and content creators, offering advanced help. Google

value.title: One of Google DeepMind’s lead developer quits to launch AI startup
value.excerpt: One of Google DeepMind’s lead developers, Ioannis Antonoglou, has quit the company to launch his own AI startup. This comes as several other lead developers have also left DeepMind recently. The departure of employees to start their own AI startups is seen as a healthy trend by Alphabet and Google CEO Sundar Pichai.

value.title: 5 ways to use Circle to Search
value.excerpt: Circle to Search is now available on select premium Android smartphones — here are some helpful ways to use it.

value.title: An AI opportunity agenda for ASEAN
value.excerpt: We’re publishing an AI Opportunity whitepaper to help ASEAN governments tap into AI’s vast potential.

value.title: Warning: Google Will Start Mass Deleting Nest Hub Features Today
value.excerpt: Google says that it is focussing its development resources on the most commonly used features and deleting less popular skills. Unofficially, it is also making way for Assistant’s likely replacement: Bard. The full cull list can be seen here, but it ...

value.title: Elon Musk's xAI may look for $6 billion to take on ChatGPT, Google Bard
value.excerpt: Elon Musk's xAI, aiming to compete with OpenAI's ChatGPT, is reportedly seeking $6 billion in funding to reach a $20 billion valuation. xAI has alread

value.title: Here's when you can expect Assistant with Bard to arrive on your Pixel phones
value.excerpt: A demo of Assistant with Bard has appeared in the Pixel Tips app. The feature could become available in an upcoming Pixel Feature Drop. It might be restricted to Tensor-powered Pixel phones. Google announced Assistant with Bard back in October and opened it up to early testers.

value.title: Google Update Reveals AI Will Read All Your Private Messages
value.excerpt: Google has just unveiled a game-changing AI upgrade for Android. But it has a darker side. Google’s AI will read and analyze your private messages, going back forever. So what does this mean for you, how do you maintain privacy, and when does it begin.

value.title: DeepMind uses AI to tackle neglected deadly diseases
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence is to be used to tackle the most deadly parasitic diseases in the developing world, tech company DeepMind has announced. The London-based Alphabet-owned lab will work with ...

value.title: Google Update Reveals AI Will Start Reading All Your Private Messages
value.excerpt: Bard also warns that such data analysis might bias its results. “AI algorithms can perpetuate biases present in the data they're trained on. Analyzing messages could lead to unintended profiling based on language, demographics, or social circles.”

value.title: New open source AI coding tool surpasses its inspiration: Google DeepMind’s AlphaCode
value.excerpt: A new open source AI code generation tool, AlphaCodium, has surpassed DeepMind's AlphaCode, which had Twitter/X all aflutter this week.

value.title: Explore the Future of Browsing with Google’s AI-Powered Chrome
value.excerpt: Google’s Chrome browser is using AI to improve the user experience. Instead of simply adding a Bard sidebar to the browser, Google is introducing features that use its models to make the browser more pleasant to use. These features are now available in ...

value.title: Warning: Google Will Start Mass Deleting Nest Hub Features Today
value.excerpt: Google’s process of deleting Assistant features, the AI that powers its Nest Hub products, starts today. Two weeks ago, the company announced that it plans to delete 17 Assistant features on January 26th: today.

value.title: Google Suddenly Reveals Huge Free AI Upgrade For All Android Users
value.excerpt: Google has spent two-years pushing its Messages app as the default Android alternative to iMessage. This has included end-to-end encryption and RCS by default, and multiple feature releases. Now, with that done, here comes an AI upgrade that connects Messages users with Google, not just with one another.

value.title: Google ends contract with Australian data firm that helped train Bard AI
value.excerpt: San Francisco: Google has terminated its contract with Australian data company Appen which helped the tech giant in training its large language model (LLM) AI tools used in Bard and Search. Appen said in an Australian exchange filing that it had no prior ...

value.title: Alphabet Terminates AI Firm Trainer of Google's Bard
value.excerpt: Appen is one of the firms that helped train Google's AI model Bard as well as other AI models from other tech giants as reported by CNBC. According to Appen, Alphabet informed the company over the weekend of the termination, which will take effect on March 19.

value.title: Alphabet cuts ties with Australian AI firm that helped train Bard and Google Search
value.excerpt: Alphabet has ended its contractual work with Appen, the artificial intelligence data firm that helped train Google's chatbot Bard and Google Search results.

value.title: Chrome is getting 3 new generative AI features
value.excerpt: Three experimental generative AI features are coming to Chrome on Macs and Windows PCs to make browsing easier and more personalized.

value.title: Google Suddenly Reveals Huge Free AI Upgrade For All Android Users
value.excerpt: Think through the path. Google has spent two-years pushing its Messages app as the default Android alternative to iMessage. This has included end-to-end encryption and RCS by default, and multiple feature releases. Now, with that done, here comes an AI upgrade that connects Messages users with Google, not just with one another.

value.title: DeepMind scientists consider founding AI startup, reportedly resign from Google
value.excerpt: This won't be the first time that Google employees leave the company to form an AI startup. (Representational photo by Google DeepMind via Pexels) Two scientists from Google's DeepMind are reportedly courting investors for an AI startup headquartered in Paris.

value.title: Google DeepMind scientists in talks to leave and form AI startup
value.excerpt: A pair of scientists at Google DeepMind, the Alphabet Inc. artificial intelligence division, have been talking with investors about forming an AI startup in Paris, according to people familiar with the conversations.

value.title: Google DeepMind Scientists Said to Be in Talks to Leave and Form AI Startup
value.excerpt: DeepMind scientists have held discussions with potential investors about a financing round that may exceed EUR 200 million (roughly Rs. 1,800 crore).

value.title: Two Google DeepMind scientists may leave company to form AI startup
value.excerpt: Two scientists affiliated with Google DeepMind are reportedly in talks to establish an AI startup in Paris. The proposed venture aims to develop a new AI model. Learn more about this significant development in the AI landscape.
